title: China Lent Heavily to Developing Nations. Now It’s Helping Them Manage Their Debt
description: A new study shows that the People’s Bank of China has deployed at least $240 billion since 2000 to assist foreign borrowers.

title: North Korean Defectors Are Dying Lonely Deaths in Wealthy South
description: Her badly decomposed body was found in a rundown Seoul apartment about a year after she died, discovered only after government housing officials sought to evict her for failing to pay the rent.

title: FBI Releases Files on Ivana Trump
description: Donald Trump’s first wife, Ivana, was under an FBI counterintelligence inquiry into allegations about her connections in her home country of Czechoslovakia in the 1990s, according to excerpts from her FBI file obtained by Bloomberg News.

title: Fears of Societal Collapse Prompt New Push for Babies in Japan
description: Alarmed by an even faster than expected slide in the number of babies born last year, Prime Minister Fumio Kishida is preparing a policy package he says is a last chance to keep society functioning.

title: Fox News Fires Producer Who Said Dominion Testimony Was Coerced
description: Fox News fired a producer who claimed she’d been coerced to give false deposition testimony in the $1.6 billion defamation suit by Dominion Voting Systems over the network’s broadcasting of 2020 election-fraud claims.

title: Four Out of Five Republicans Think Trump Probes Are ‘Witch Hunt’
description: Four out of five Republicans consider the myriad investigations into Donald Trump as “a witch hunt,” a phrase the former president routinely deploys to undermine the cases, according to a new poll.

title: Biden Condemns ‘Sick’ Deadly School Shooting in Nashville
description: President Joe Biden again called on Congress to ban assault weapons and take other steps to address gun violence following another deadly school shooting, this time in Nashville, Tennessee.

title: Celebrities Idris Elba, Sheryl Lee Ralph Join Vice President Harris in Ghana
description: Vice President Kamala Harris surprised onlookers in Ghana when she stopped at a local recording studio joined by two famous Black actors.

title: Three Things to Watch as Congress Begins Banking Hearings
description: Congressional committees are poised to start probing the collapse of Silicon Valley Bank and Signature Bank, offering a stage for what’s likely to be a partisan clash over the role of financial regulations — and the people charged with enforcing them — in the second-largest bank failure in US history.

title: Israel’s Netanyahu Pauses Legal Overhaul Push After Protests
description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu delayed a controversial plan to weaken the judiciary after the proposals triggered mass protests and nationwide strikes.

title: Brazil’s Lula Is Recovering From Flu and Working From Home
description: Brazil’s President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva is recovering quickly from the illness that caused him to postpone a trip to China but is currently conducting internal meetings only from his home at the country’s presidential residence, according to Institutional Relations Minister Alexandre Padilha.

title: UK Civil Servants Plan Strike as School Leaders Reject Pay Offer
description: UK school leaders rejected a government pay offer and 133,000 civil servants announced plans to strike, dealing Rishi Sunak’s government a blow as it seeks to draw a line under months of industrial action.

title: Four Billion of US Remittances to Mexico Could Be Linked to Crime
description: Nearly 8% of the record $58 billion that Mexicans mainly living in the US sent home last year appear to be linked to illegal activities, including money laundering, according to a new report by a Mexico-based data think tank.

title: Hungary Ratifies Finland’s NATO Bid, Leaving Sweden in the Cold
description: Hungary voted to support Finland’s accession to NATO, ending months of foot-dragging by Prime Minister Viktor Orban and leaving the Nordic country one step away from joining the defense alliance.

title: Kenya Protests Intensify as Opposition Leader Defies Government
description: Protests in Kenya’s capital intensified as opposition leader Raila Odinga defied the government’s move to stop him.

title: Italy Prepares €4.9 Billion Aid as Part of Support Phase-Out
description: Giorgia Meloni, Italy's prime minister, speaks to the media on day two of the European Union (EU) leaders summit at the European Council headquarters in Brussels, Belgium, on Friday, March 24, 2023. The EU’s military support for Ukraine featured among the key topics of discussion when the bloc’s leaders gathered in Brussels.

title: Senate Republicans Try a New Tactic to Overturn Biden’s Student Loan Plan
description: Senate Republicans are attempting to overturn President Joe Biden’s student loan forgiveness program by deploying a procedural tactic that allows them to avert a filibuster and pass it by a simple majority.

title: Paris’s Garbage Piles Begin to Recede as More Trucks Make Rounds
description: The garbage standoff in Paris, one of the most visible signs of public frustration over President Emmanuel Macron’s plan to raise the minimum retirement age, appears to finally be abating.

title: Netanyahu’s Coalition Partner Says Israel Can Delay Legal Push
description: The party of Israel’s National Security Minister Itamar Ben Gvir agreed to a delay in approving the judicial overhaul that’s plunged Israel into turmoil.

title: South Africa Public Workers Signal Acceptance of State Pay Hike
description: South African public servants are likely to accept the government’s latest wage offer, according an initial estimate of a ballot of labor-union members.

title: Support for South Africa’s Populist Opposition Has Plunged, Poll Shows
description: South Africa’s populist opposition party, the Economic Freedom Fighters, has seen its support plunge by about half in the last eight months, a Social Research Foundation poll shows.

title: Israel Turmoil Forces Netanyahu to Mull Judicial U-Turn
description: Israel was in turmoil on Monday, with a general strike halting flight departures and limiting access to the health and legal systems as pressure intensified on Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to freeze his plan to shift power from the Supreme Court to the legislature.

title: IMF Team Initiates Talks on New Funding Program For War-Wracked Ethiopia
description: International Monetary Fund officials are visiting Ethiopia for talks on a new support program as the country emerges from two years of civil war that hammered the economy.

title: Anti-EU Party May Emerge as Kingmaker Ahead of Poland’s Election
description: A Polish party known for its hostility toward the European Union and wariness of the nation’s unconditional support for Ukraine is making gains with voters six months before an election.

title: Elizabeth Warren Launches Senate Reelection Bid for 2024
description: Democratic Senator Elizabeth Warren of Massachusetts formally announced she’s seeking a third term in 2024, vowing to continue pressing a progressive agenda that includes stricter rules on banks in the wake of the recent collapse of Silicon Valley Bank and Signature Bank.

title: SNP Elects Humza Yousaf as New Leader After Chaotic Race
description: Humza Yousaf won the contest to replace Nicola Sturgeon as head of the pro-independence Scottish National Party after a fractious battle that laid bare the scale of the challenge to unite the party and country.

title: Putin’s Belarus Nuclear Move Puts Him at Odds With China Pledge
description: While Russian President Vladimir Putin’s plan to station nuclear weapons in neighboring Belarus is unlikely to change Europe’s strategic balance, it has put him at odds with a pledge he made with Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping just days earlier.

title: Israeli Workers Seek to Cripple Economy Over Judicial Overhaul
description: Israel’s biggest labor group triggered one of the most widespread strikes in the country’s history to paralyze the economy and pressure Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to halt a plan to dramatically weaken the judiciary.

title: Prince Harry Clashes With Daily Mail in UK Snooping Lawsuit
description: Prince Harry showed up at a London court hearing into allegations that the Daily Mail tabloid committed wholesale privacy breaches including snooping on phone calls and voicemails of celebrities.

title: Nigeria’s Ruling Party Sweeps Parliament, Governorships in Votes
description: Nigeria’s ruling party looks set to retain its dominance of the country’s political offices after elections held in recent weeks.

title: French Refineries Are Barely Running as Strikes Enter Week Four
description: France’s oil-processing industry is running at a fraction of normal capacity as worker strikes enter their fourth week.

title: Botswana to Take Stake in HB, Challenging De Beers’ Dominance
description: Botswana will take a 24% stake in Belgian diamond trader HB Antwerp in a challenge to a decades old arrangement with De Beers, the world’s biggest diamond company.

title: Russian Oil Flows Hold Fast Even as Kremlin Says Output Slashed
description: Seaborne crude exports remain above 3 million barrels a day for a sixth week

title: Night of Rage Puts Netanyahu in a Tight Corner
description: Things are going from bad to worse for Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.

title: Jeremy Corbyn Set to Be Blocked as Labour Candidate at Next Election
description: Jeremy Corbyn is set to be blocked from standing as a Labour candidate at the next general election, with Sir Keir Starmer set to bring a motion confirming the move to a meeting of the party's ruling body.

title: Prosecutors Have Another Foe in Cases Against Trump: Time
description: Nothing prevents the Justice Department or the Atlanta-based district attorney from charging Donald Trump if he’s indicted in Manhattan. But a bottleneck would make it harder for each case to be tried before the 2024 election cycle is in full swing.

title: Hong Kong’s Exports Slide as Weak Global Demand Hits Recovery
description: Hong Kong’s exports fell for a ninth consecutive month in February as demand for goods from China and the rest of the world remained weak, weighing on the financial hub’s post-pandemic recovery.

title: Israel Latest: Protests Swell as Netanyahu Mulls Judicial Steps
description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu considered a delay in his judicial overhaul plan after demonstrations escalated overnight, local media reported, while the country’s main trade union began a strike affecting departures from the international airport.

title: Founder of iPhone Maker Foxconn to Visit US to Rev Up Taiwan Presidential Bid
description: Terry Gou, the billionaire founder of Foxconn Technology Group, is embarking on a 12-day trip to the US, as the independent presidential hopeful seeks to convince voters of his ability to lead Taiwan and balance its business and security priorities.

title: German Coalition Still Locked in Talks After All-Night Wrangling
description: Top officials from Germany’s three-party ruling coalition were still locked in talks after around 15 hours seeking agreement on issues including modernizing Germany’s highway system and measures to protect the climate.

title: Taiwan's Former Leader Ma Begins Private China Visit
description: TAOYUAN, Taiwan (AP) — Former Taiwan President Ma Ying-jeou departed for a tour of China Monday, in what he called an attempt to reduce tensions a day after Taiwan lost one of its few remaining diplomatic partners to China.

title: Indonesia Tax Office Eyes Exit From Finance Ministry Amid Probe
description: Indonesia’s tax officers are mulling a proposal to split away from the Finance Ministry as a probe into a $20 billion scandal looms over them, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Netanyahu Mulls Delay to Courts Overhaul As Protests Rock Israel
description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is considering a delay in his judicial overhaul plan after a night of angry demonstrations over his sacking of a dissenting minister.

title: Ukraine Latest: Hungary to Vote on Finland’s Bid to Join NATO
description: Hungary is slated to vote on the ratification of Finland’s application to join the North Atlantic Treaty Organization, putting Helsinki one step closer to joining the alliance.

title: Israeli President Urges Netanyahu to Halt Legal Overhaul
description: TEL AVIV, Israel (AP) — Israel’s ceremonial president on Monday urged Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to immediately halt a contentious overhaul of the judiciary.

title: In Pictures: Mass Protests Erupt in Israel Over Supreme Court Plan
description: Thousands of protesters took to the streets in Israel after Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu fired his defense chief for criticizing a plan to reduce the power of the Supreme Court. Protesters clashed with police outside Netanyahu’s home, while others massed near the defense ministry in Tel Aviv in support of ousted Minister Yoav Gallant.

title: Ukraine Visit Buoys Japan Premier Kishida Before Local Elections
description: Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida received a much-sought rise in his support rate after a trip to Ukraine met with broad approval from the public ahead of a series of local and special elections.

title: Plan to Curb Coal, Gas Projects to Seal Australia Climate Pact
description: Australia’s government is expected to win approval for its flagship climate policy after agreeing new action to limit development of new coal and gas projects, according to the Greens Party.

title: Bangladesh Leader Bets IMF-Mandated Rigor Will Pay Off in Polls
description: Government leaders across the world have often balked at implementing reforms agreed with the International Monetary Fund for fear of being penalized at the ballot box. Bangladesh Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina isn’t one of them.

title: China Detains Employee of Japanese Drugmaker Astellas
description: Chinese authorities have detained an employee of Japanese drugmaker Astellas Pharma Inc., with the island nation urging the government to release the man.

title: Jack Ma’s Self-Exile Undercuts China’s Pitch to Private Business
description: Even as leaders voice “unwavering support” for the private sector, one of the country’s best-known entrepreneurs is choosing to remain overseas.
